body_html:
Sorry everyone, I was on vacation for the last two weeks.

In my opinion, if the options are applied to all compile or linking actions, they should be added into CROSSTOOL, that also means TF team has to maintain their own CROSSTOOL file.

And for options, like -DTF_COMPILE_LIBRARY, that are only supposed to be applied to certain targets, using a macro would be better.

Some modules under tensorflow/contrib is part of _pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so

@gunan @snnn Is this true? I didn't notice any targets under tensorflow/contrib that's a part of _pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so

And for options, like -DTF_COMPILE_LIBRARY, that are only supposed to be applied to certain targets, using a macro would be better.

body:
Sorry everyone, I was on vacation for the last two weeks.

In my opinion, if the options are applied to all compile or linking actions, they should be added into CROSSTOOL, that also means TF team has to maintain their own CROSSTOOL file.

And for options, like `-DTF_COMPILE_LIBRARY`, that are only supposed to be applied to certain targets, using a macro would be better.

> Some modules under tensorflow/contrib is part of _pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so

@gunan @snnn Is this true? I didn't notice any targets under tensorflow/contrib that's a part of _pywrap_tensorflow_internal.so
